clinical_study.brief_title: Surgery During Covid-19: The Role of Asymptomatic Patients, a Survey
clinical_study.official_title: Surgery During Covid-19: The Role of Asymptomatic Patients, a Survey

brief_summary.textblock:
a brief questionnaire to get a clearer picture of the situation regarding surgical patients
      with special emphasis on asymptomatic Covid-19 patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
With new evidence on the role of asymptomatic patients in spreading the disease during the
      Covid-19 pandemic, symptom driven guidelines for testing, hospital allocation and personal
      protective equipment (PPE) use do not seem appropriate to limit in-hospital transmission. At
      time when lockdowns are in place in most countries, hospitals can become the new source of
      infection.

      Guidelines are very variable depending on local policies and availability of medical
      supplies, resulting in most hospitals taking different preventive measures.

primary_outcome.measure: overview of surgical management on preventive measures of hospital infection spread during covid 19

secondary_outcome.measure: testing policies and preventive measures for Covid-19, and their association with asymptomatic cases.
